skill.name: agent-coordination
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user asks about "coordinate coding agents", "orchestrate agent team", "manage multiple agents", "vibekanban workflow", "task delegation to agents", "agent swarm coordination", "parallel agent execution", "chief of staff mode", "cos mode", "you're my cos", "your my cos", "act as cos", "be my cos", "you are my chief of staff", "create tasks for agents", "dispatch agents", or needs guidance on coordinating autonomous coding agents, task breakdown strategies, or multi-agent workflow patterns.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when the user asks about "coordinate coding agents", "orchestrate agent te...
skill.author: ClementWalter

security_audit.summary: Documentation-focused skill for agent coordination. The only executable script (monitor-pr-ci.py) safely wraps gh CLI commands with hardcoded arguments. Static findings are false positives triggered by markdown documentation code blocks and YAML frontmatter. No actual security risks identified.

content.value_statement: Managing multiple coding agents requires clear task definitions and coordination patterns. This skill provides Chief of Staff workflows, two-tier delegation patterns, and VibeKanban integration to orchestrate autonomous agent teams efficiently.
actual_capabilities: Activate Chief of Staff mode for persistent agent coordination
Create well-scoped tasks with acceptance criteria for agents
Use two-tier delegation: investigation tasks for planning, implementation tasks for execution
Track task status and agent progress through VibeKanban MCP tools
Monitor CI status for pull requests using gh CLI
Apply anti-patterns to avoid coordination failures
limitations: Requires VibeKanban MCP server for full functionality
Does not directly execute code or write files in user projects
GitHub CI monitoring requires gh CLI installation
Agent execution depends on configured executors and repositories

use_cases.title: Orchestrate Agent Teams
use_cases.description: Delegate complex features to specialized agents while maintaining visibility and quality control

use_cases.title: Monitor CI at Scale
use_cases.description: Track CI status across multiple PRs with automated waiting and failure detection

use_cases.title: Break Down Features
use_cases.description: Transform feature requests into actionable tasks with clear scope and acceptance criteria

prompt_templates.title: Activate CoS Mode
prompt_templates.prompt: Act as my Chief of Staff. I want you to coordinate coding agents for my project.

prompt_templates.title: Create Investigation Task
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an investigation task to understand the scope of refactoring our authentication system.

prompt_templates.title: Delegate Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Based on the investigation, create implementation tasks for the refactor. Use Haiku for simple changes and Sonnet for complex ones.

prompt_templates.title: Monitor Multiple PRs
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the CI status for PR #456 and PR #458. Wait for both to complete and report results.

output_examples.input: Act as my Chief of Staff. I need to add dark mode support to the app.
output: âœ“ Chief of Staff mode activated. Ready for task delegation.
Creating investigation task: 'Investigate: Dark mode implementation scope'
Task #142 created with investigation tier. Agent exploring codebase...
Once investigation completes, I'll create implementation tasks using the detailed plan.

output_examples.input: Create a task to fix the login bug on the login page
output: I'll create a bug fix task with clear acceptance criteria.
Title: Bug: Login button unresponsive on Safari iOS
Context: Users report login failures on iOS Safari browsers
Acceptance: Login works on Safari iOS 15+, no console errors

best_practices: Use the two-tier model: expensive models for investigation, cheap models for implementation
Always include acceptance criteria and scope boundaries in task descriptions
Verify VibeKanban MCP tools are available before starting coordination
Track blocked agents and escalate decisions that exceed their scope
anti_patterns: Writing code instead of delegating after CoS mode activation
Creating vague tasks without context or acceptance criteria
Assigning tasks that are too large or lack clear scope boundaries
Ignoring agent blockers for more than 30 minutes

faq.question: Which AI tools are supported?
faq.answer: Claude and Claude Code are supported. The skill works with VibeKanban MCP tools for task management.

faq.question: What is the two-tier delegation model?
faq.answer: Use Opus/Sonnet for investigation tasks that require planning, then Haiku/Sonnet for implementation tasks that follow the plan.

faq.question: How does CoS mode persist?
faq.answer: Once activated, CoS mode persists for the entire conversation. All requests become task delegations until explicitly reverted.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only accesses VibeKanban MCP tools and runs read-only gh CLI commands for CI monitoring.

faq.question: Why is gh CLI required?
faq.answer: The monitor-pr-ci.py script uses gh CLI for efficient GitHub API access. No direct network calls are made.

faq.question: How is this different from regular Claude Code?
faq.answer: As Chief of Staff, you delegate rather than execute. Create tasks instead of writing code directly.
